title: Generate A Dungeon Map — generate_dungeon
text: Procedurally generate tile-based ASCII-character dungeon map. Creates tile-based map user-specified size; places randomly user-specified number rooms; connects continuous corridor; iteratively expands interior space sampling adjacent tiles. Note: much function absorbed start_game function, generate_dungeon continue exported now.

title: Generate A Dungeon Map — generate_dungeon

title: Play A Roguelike Game — start_game
text: Use WASD keys move , left, right. Use '1' key eat apple inventory. Use '0' quit game. terminal supports 'keypress' package, can use single keypress input (e.g. arrow key), otherwise type prompt press 'Enter'.Use has_keypress_support see 'keypress' supported. Symbols used game follows: . floor tile # wall @ player (10 HP max, -1 HP attack damage) $ gold (+1 +3 G) E enemy (3 HP max, -1 HP attack damage) apple (+1 HP)

title: r.oguelike 0.0.0.9006
text: Integrated sub-functions generate_dungeon() start_game() (#7), replacing simple rectangular rooms. Added ‘quit’ keypress (0) exit game. Updated function documentation/comments variable names clarity. Updated README given dungeon map changes. Added hex sticker design, favicons.

title: r.oguelike 0.0.0.9005
text: Added generate_dungeon() randomised/procedural dungeon creation (#7).

title: r.oguelike 0.0.0.9004
